channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: 4 U.S. Soldiers Disappear During a Lithuanian Training Mission
item.description: A U.S. military official said the soldiers were in a heavy vehicle, which may have sunk in a swamp in eastern Lithuania, near the border with Belarus.

item.title: Amazon allure grows with shares now cheaper than Apple and Walmart
item.description: “You’d be hard pressed to look at Amazon’s multiple here and not see it as appealing," said Clayton Allison, portfolio manager at Prime Capital Financ...

item.title: Trump Allies Grill PBS and NPR During Congress Hearing

item.title: Walmart CEO Doug McMillon says customers are exhibiting ‘stressed behaviors’—and it’s already tanked the company’s valuation by $22 billion
item.description: The retailer’s stock dropped on the news that consumer confidence had hit a 12-year low.

item.title: How the White House Uses Semantics to Downplay the Signal Leak
item.description: War plan or battle plan? Classified or not? The answers to those questions amount to a distinction without much of a difference.

item.title: Luigi Mangione Was Sent Socks With Heart-Shaped Notes Inside, Prosecutors Say
item.description: In filings, lawyers for the man accused of assassinating a health care executive argued with prosecutors over special treatment and his access to evid...

item.title: Leaked text messages reveal the U.S. bombed the Houthis’ ‘top missile guy’ as he was ‘walking into his girlfriend’s building’
item.description: The newly released messages reveal how top U.S. officials planned military strikes against terrorists in Yemen.

item.title: Don’t water down Europe’s AI rules to please Trump, EU lawmakers warn
item.description: "It would never be enough," AI Act lead negotiator Brando Benifei tells Fortune of any effort to appease the Trump White House

item.title: Canada investigates whether Tesla wrongfully helped itself to a subsidy-fueled sales boom
item.description: Tesla sold the equivalent of about 18% of its annual volumes in Canada in just three days across four stores with the help of $30 million in subsidies...

item.title: 4 U.S. Soldiers Disappear During a Lithuanian Training Mission
item.description: A U.S. military official said the soldiers were in a heavy vehicle, which may have sunk in a swamp in eastern Lithuania, near the border with Belarus.

item.title: Jair Bolsonaro Ordered to Face Trial in Brazil for Attempting a Coup
item.description: Brazil’s top court ruled that the former president will be tried over his role in a vast plot to cling to power after his 2022 election loss.

item.title: Turkey’s Opposition Calls for Boycott and Mass Protests After Arrest of Istanbul Mayor
item.description: To pressure President Recep Tayyip Erdogan over the jailing of his top rival, the opposition wants Turks to boycott companies that back Mr. Erdogan an...

item.title: UK University Gets Record Fine Over Free Speech on Campus
item.description: A regulator penalized the school three years after a professor quit in response to what she said was a campaign of harassment over her views on transg...

item.title: What to Know About the Only US Military Base in Greenland
item.description: Since World War II, American forces have been stationed on the island. Today, from a remote outpost, they watch the skies.
